emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Code Automation
emerging_technologies.description: Systems that not only assist but can autonomously generate, debug, and deploy software based on high-level requirements.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces human error in coding, speeds up development cycles, but might lead to job displacement in software engineering.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires significant advancements in AI trust and security; adoption depends on regulatory approval and ethical considerations.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Lace Interface
emerging_technologies.description: A brain-computer interface that integrates directly with the brain to enhance cognitive abilities or control digital devices.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for cognitive enhancement, but raises ethical questions about privacy, identity, and equality.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will be slow due to ethical concerns, regulatory hurdles, and the need for non-invasive or reversible implantation methods.

emerging_technologies.name: Zero-Emission Autonomous Vehicles
emerging_technologies.description: Autonomous vehicles designed with zero-emission capabilities, leveraging electric and hydrogen technologies.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduction in pollution and traffic accidents, but also potential job loss in traditional automotive sectors.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial costs, infrastructure development, and regulatory approval for autonomous operation on public roads.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain protocols designed to withstand quantum computing attacks, ensuring long-term data integrity.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Secures financial transactions and data against future quantum threats, potentially reshaping trust in digital systems.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will be driven by the fear of quantum computing's potential to break current encryption, but also depends on the development of practical quantum computers.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Enhanced Software Development Tools
mainstream_technologies.description: Tools that integrate AI for coding assistance, from auto-complete to full project management.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in software companies, with ongoing debates about the balance of human and AI involvement in development.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart Infrastructure
mainstream_technologies.description: Cities and buildings equipped with IoT devices for energy management, traffic control, and public safety.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Standard in new urban developments, with retrofitting occurring in older cities.

epoch_themes.description: The pervasive integration of AI into everyday life, from coding to personal assistants.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Streamlines many processes, raises issues around employment, privacy, and ethical AI use.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing global push towards AI ethics regulation and education in AI technologies.

epoch_themes.description: Technologies aimed at reducing environmental impact and fostering sustainability.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes cleaner living environments, but requires societal shifts in behavior and economic models.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased investment in green technology, policy shifts towards carbon neutrality, and a rise in green consumerism.
